{"step_by_step_thinking": "First, I need to understand what bone anchor fixation and percutaneous bladder neck suspension are. From the documents, I understand that these are surgical procedures used to treat stress urinary incontinence in women. Now, I need to look at the results of these procedures. Document [0] and [7] report high cure rates with the use of bone-anchoring technique. However, Document [1] and [10] report poor long-term results with the use of bone anchor fixation. Document [2] and [18] also report that long-term healing is only achieved in about half the cases and the technique appears to be unsuitable for treating severe stress incontinence. Document [13] reports poor wound healing and resultant irritative symptoms with the use of bone anchoring. Document [25] reports a 31% continence rate at 5 years with the use of bone anchoring. Document [27] reports that both abdominal suspension and pubovaginal sling gave good results, with pubovaginal sling being superior in terms of shorter hospitalization, early recovery, and overall patient satisfaction.
